section.heading: Membership.

para.text: The composition of the Advisory Council shall be as follows:
Up to 6 resident-owner representatives, each of whom who is currently a board member of an LEC in the District; provided, that no 2 residents shall be from the board of the same LEC;
Two representatives from a community-based organization, including:
One of whom has experience in the formation of LECs, including the legal and organizational structure of the LEC; and
One of whom has experience in ongoing technical assistance required to sustain LECs;
One representative from a property management company that manages cooperatives in the District;
One representative from a development company that develops cooperatives in the District;
One representative from a financial entity that specializes in the financing of LECs;
One attorney who has experience working with LECs;
One individual who has conducted significant academic research on LECs in the District and elsewhere in the United States;
Other representatives appointed by the Chairperson of the Council committee responsible for housing issues;
One representative from the Department of Housing and Community
Development ("DHCD"); and
One representative from the District of Columbia Housing Finance Agency.
The Chairperson of the Council committee responsible for housing issues shall appoint the:
Chair of the Advisory Council; and
Advisory Council representatives designated in subsection (a)(1) through (8) of this section.
The members of the Advisory Council shall:
Serve for a period of 2 years;
Either reside or work in the District; and
Serve without compensation.
Meetings of the Advisory Council shall be open to the public.
The Advisory Council shall meet at least 6 times each year.

The Advisory Council may request administrative support from the Director of DHCD, who shall provide support as the Director of DHCD and not as a member of the Advisory Council for all such reasonable requests to prepare for the required reports and meetings of the Advisory Council.
